Thanks for replying Simon.

Actually my logger variable was being initialized in ejbCreate() and 
hence in my target method it was null.

Thanks.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Chappell, Simon P" 
<simon.chappell@l...> wrote:
> 
> 
> >-----Original Message-----
> >From: khyati@z... [mailto:khyati@z...]
> >Sent: Monday, April 19, 2004 3:18 AM
> >To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> >Subject: [junit] Cannot access public variable in testee class 
> >from test
> >case
> >
> >
> > Hello, 
> >
> >I am new to JUnit and am using JUnit with JBuilder. 
> 
> Welcome to the community. :-)
> 
> >I am calling a method of a testee class from my test case... 
> 
> Is "testee" a real word? I prefer "target" class.
> 
> >Now in the testee method, it has to access a global 
variable "logger" 
> >(required for logging purpose) defined in that class. 
> >
> >When i run the test case it gives me NullPointertException for 
> >"logger" as it is not able to access it. 
> 
> That sounds like it can't access it to me as well.
> 
> >Can someone please tell me why it cannot access "logger"... 
> 
> I really don't want to sound like J.B. here, but I think that we 
need to see some code. Can you extract the smallest portion of your 
code that still displays the reported symptom, post it here and some 
of our finest people will take a look at it.
> 
> >Thanks in advance.
> >
> >Khyati 
> 
> Simon
